content:
• Wednesday, October 5, 2011
  • CMTL

    Comtech (NASDAQ:CMTL) jumps 9.3% AH after Reuters reports of "takeover interest from several...

    Comtech (NASDAQ:CMTL) jumps 9.3% AH after Reuters reports of "takeover interest from several government contractors," citing sources. MMI Investments, an activist investor with a 3.3% stake in Comtech, has long pushed for a deal, and nominated two board members last week.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM
  • GLW

    Corning (NYSE:GLW) gains 4.8% AH after boosting its quarterly dividend 50%, to $0.075/share, and...

    Corning (NYSE:GLW) gains 4.8% AH after boosting its quarterly dividend 50%, to $0.075/share, and announcing a $1.5B stock buyback. Corning's annual dividend yield now stands at approximately 2.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM | 3 Comments
  • OCZ

    Solid-state drive maker OCZ Technology (NASDAQ:OCZ) jumps 10.7% AH after reporting FQ2 earnings....

    Solid-state drive maker OCZ Technology (NASDAQ:OCZ) jumps 10.7% AH after reporting FQ2 earnings. Though results were mixed - revenue of $78.5M (+106% Y/Y) beat consensus by $0.8M, but EPS of -$0.03 missed by $0.06 - OCZ is boosting its FY12 revenue guidance, and now expects to reach its long-term gross margin target sooner than expected. STEC is up 2.4% in sympathy.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM | 2 Comments
  • RT

    Ruby Tuesday (NYSE:RT) drops 6.4% AH after reporting FQ1 revenue of $330.3M (+9% Y/Y) and EPS of...

    Ruby Tuesday (NYSE:RT) drops 6.4% AH after reporting FQ1 revenue of $330.3M (+9% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.05; the latter was in-line, but the former missed consensus by $3.7M. Same-restaurant sales at company-owned locations declined 4.1% Y/Y. The company expects FQ2 EPS of -$0.04 to -$0.08, well below a $0.05 consensus. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO +10.1%), which took off on a report Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) is weighing a bid, drops...

    Yahoo (YHOO +10.1%), which took off on a report Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) is weighing a bid, drops 3.6% AH as Kara Swisher, who broke the first reports of buyout interest, says her sources tell her "Microsoft execs have taken pains to make it clear" they won't be bidding for Yahoo. She adds that much of the current M&A speculation is "being pumped up by bankers."
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 5 Comments
  • ZUMZ

    Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ) says September comparable store sales jumped a much better than anticipated...

    Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ) says September comparable store sales jumped a much better than anticipated 10.1%. The company boosts its Q3 guidance, now expecting Q3 sales of $150M to $152M and an EPS of $0.40 to $0.41, better than analyst estimates for an EPS of $0.39 on $149M in sales. Shares +14.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • COMV

    Comverge (COMV -3.6%) fails to rally with the broader market today after Baird cut the shares...

    Comverge (COMV -3.6%) fails to rally with the broader market today after Baird cut the shares earlier to neutral from outperform. The firm cites limited near-term catalysts for the downgrade, including liquidity issues and increased industry competition.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • MS

    Morgan Stanley (MS +4.2%) is romping again after telling Fox's Charlie Gasparino that their Q3...

    Morgan Stanley (MS +4.2%) is romping again after telling Fox's Charlie Gasparino that their Q3 looks "solid" and likely will beat Goldman's (NYSE:GS) numbers. It's a vague reminder of the March 2009 rally which began with Citi's leak that its Q1 numbers would be great.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM | 2 Comments
  • JAKK

    Toymaker JAKKS Pacific (JAKK -2%) trades lower after publishing an open letter from its CEO...

    Toymaker JAKKS Pacific (JAKK -2%) trades lower after publishing an open letter from its CEO declaring Oaktree Capital's $20/share bid for the company to be "inadequate."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM
  • MXL

    MaxLinear (MXL -7%) takes a hit after Morgan Stanley cut the shares to overweight and removed...

    MaxLinear (MXL -7%) takes a hit after Morgan Stanley cut the shares to overweight and removed its $12 price target after the company cut its FY12 EPS targets. In additon to the lowered EPS targets, Morgan also cites weakness in the company's consumer end-market.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM
  • DAL

    Delta (DAL +2.5%) gains after reporting its system traffic (as measured in passenger miles)...

    Delta (DAL +2.5%) gains after reporting its system traffic (as measured in passenger miles) declined 0.9% Y/Y, but its load factor increased 1.1%. Other major airlines are also performing well today. AMR +5.4%. UAL +6.5%. LCC +4.2%. (more on AMR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • MSFT

    Fortune's man on deals, Dan Primack cracks, "wouldn't it be bigger news if Microsoft...

    Fortune's man on deals, Dan Primack cracks, "wouldn't it be bigger news if Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) wasn't at least 'considering' bidding for Yahoo (YHOO)." He also says Mister Softee's big purchases tend to "(come) out of nowhere," while the rumored ones never pan out. YHOO +8.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • EA

    Electronic Arts (ERTS) flexes its legal muscles with a lawsuit against an-EA knockoff called...

    Electronic Arts (ERTS) flexes its legal muscles with a lawsuit against an-EA knockoff called Energy Armor in Florida - accused of trying to associate professional athletes with its trademark name. Shares of ERTS, up 2.4%, may be getting a bit of a lift today from the flurry of Xbox news.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO +8.8%) surges on a rumor Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) is considering a bid for the...

    Yahoo (YHOO +8.8%) surges on a rumor Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) is considering a bid for the company.  (more)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM | 2 Comments
  • ATEC

    Shares of Alphatec (ATEC +8.8%) spike higher after the firm announces it has resolved a FDA...

    Shares of Alphatec (ATEC +8.8%) spike higher after the firm announces it has resolved a FDA complaint in connection with deficiencies noted in an inspection in 2010.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • KERX

    Keryx Biopharmaceuticals (KERX +4.2%) is trading higher after saying an article on phase 2...

    Keryx Biopharmaceuticals (KERX +4.2%) is trading higher after saying an article on phase 2 activity of its drug KRX-0401 has been selected for publication in the October 3 online edition of the Journal of Clinical Oncology. The drug is used to treat patients with refractory, advanced colorectal cancer.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM
  • JOY

    Joy Global (JOYG) runs up a solid 6.8% gain - outperforming peers CAT and DE on the day. The...

    Joy Global (JOYG) runs up a solid 6.8% gain - outperforming peers CAT and DE on the day. The rally started late yesterday, possibly kickstarted when Palisade Capital Management's Dan Veru said the company would make a good target for Warren Buffett. "He's really playing on a global recovery, and certainly Joy Global would be one of the names that would fit.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM
  • ACOR

    Citigroup gives a boost to Acorda Therapeutics (ACOR +4.5%) after the firm upgrades the shares...

    Citigroup gives a boost to Acorda Therapeutics (ACOR +4.5%) after the firm upgrades the shares to buy from hold, citing the recent pullback in price.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • FONR

    Microcap biotech firm FONAR (FONR +19.6%) soars after announcing a diagnostic breakthrough in...

    Microcap biotech firm FONAR (FONR +19.6%) soars after announcing a diagnostic breakthrough in its multiple sclerosis research, based on observations using its upright multi-position MRI. The findings reveal the cause of multiple sclerosis may be biomechanical, related to earlier trauma to the neck, which can result in obstruction of the flow of cerebrospinal fluid.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • YUM

    Jefferies adds some color to Yum Brands' (YUM -2.8%) FQ3 report: "We find YUM attractive for its...

    Jefferies adds some color to Yum Brands' (YUM -2.8%) FQ3 report: "We find YUM attractive for its global growth, but valuation already considers stronger China growth." The firm keeps its EPS estimates in place, while raising its call on revenue for FY11 and FY12 to $12,497B and $13.287B, respectively.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • CELG

    Celgene (CELG +4.4%) gains after it agrees ahead of schedule to extend its exclusivity agreement...

    Celgene (CELG +4.4%) gains after it agrees ahead of schedule to extend its exclusivity agreement with Agios from three to four years. Under the terms of the new agreement, Celgene has an exclusive option to drug candidates generated by Agios' cancer metabolism research for a $20 million payment, and it will retain the option to extend the period further in the future.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • ROC

    Rockwell (ROC +7.3%) shares jump as JPMorgan upgrades to Overweight from Neutral following a...

    Rockwell (ROC +7.3%) shares jump as JPMorgan upgrades to Overweight from Neutral following a recent selloff and in anticipation of a strong Q3 report. But the firm also cuts its 2012 EPS outlook for the chemical maker to $4.20 from $4.70, due to European exposure and softer demand for its products in construction and electronics markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • AZO

    AutoZone (AZO -1.4%) withstood some insider selling this week, according to a SEC filing. The...

    AutoZone (AZO -1.4%) withstood some insider selling this week, according to a SEC filing. The action flies in the face of analysts who continue to view the stock as a "defensive play" to the threat of a U.S. recession.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • NVAX

    Bio-pharmaceutical developer Novavax (NVAX +4%) trades higher after winning a $1.3M contract...

    Bio-pharmaceutical developer Novavax (NVAX +4%) trades higher after winning a $1.3M contract from the U.S. Department of Homeland Security to develop a virus-like particle vaccine countermeasure to protect against foot-and-mouth disease.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM
  • CHINA

    CDC Corp. (CHINA -51.7%), a Hong Kong-based provider of software and IT services, crashes after...

    CDC Corp. (CHINA -51.7%), a Hong Kong-based provider of software and IT services, crashes after filing for Chapter 11 bankruptcy. A $65.4M legal judgment issued against the company last month may have been the final straw.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM | 5 Comments
  • TMO

    Thermo Fisher (TMO +3.8%) gains after Oppenheimer initiates it with an outperform on valuation,...

    Thermo Fisher (TMO +3.8%) gains after Oppenheimer initiates it with an outperform on valuation, and Deutsche calls the stock its "top pick" in the space.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM
  • ANDV

    Several energy stocks rank among the day's top gainers, as crude oil prices spike following...

    Several energy stocks rank among the day's top gainers, as crude oil prices spike following weekly inventory data showing a draw of 4.7M barrels vs. expectations for a build of 1.1M. Among S&P leaders: TSO +9.6%, ANR +9%, MPC +8.4%, VLO +7%, MRO +6%. Missing the rally:Lufkin (LUFK -12%), after cutting its Q3 outlook. Nymex crude +3.9% to $78.60.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM
  • CBS

    Media shares are higher today, boosted by valuation upgrades of CBS (CBS +3.5%) and Walt Disney...

    Media shares are higher today, boosted by valuation upgrades of CBS (CBS +3.5%) and Walt Disney (DIS +2.8%) by Citigroup (I, II), and Roth's adding of Imax (IMAX +8%) to its focus list: AOL (AOL +5%), Time Warner (TWX +0.6%).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM
  • BK

    Bank of New York (BK -4.1%) sells off after both New York's AG and the Justice Department sue...

    Bank of New York (BK -4.1%) sells off after both New York's AG and the Justice Department sue the company for allegedly defrauding clients in forex transactions. The former suit is seeking nearly $2B in damages, and leverages a New York state law that doesn't require prosecutors to prove an intent to defraud.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • STP

    Solar stocks rally hard for the second straight day. In addition to short-covering, shares could...

    Solar stocks rally hard for the second straight day. In addition to short-covering, shares could be getting a lift from an IHS report predicting German solar demand will rebound in October and November, ahead of a January subsidy cut. STP +15.1%. YGE +12.5%. JASO +8.2%. LDK +6.1%. FSLR +5.5%. TSL +6.6%. (yesterday)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM | 2 Comments
  • CMG

    Chipotle (CMG -2.6%) keeps its winning ways moving forward with an upgrade from Credit Suisse to...

    Chipotle (CMG -2.6%) keeps its winning ways moving forward with an upgrade from Credit Suisse to Outperform and a sky-high price target of $370. The cocktail party stock is an easy momentum draw with the obvious popularity of its Mexican (and now Asian) food to go along with an impressive 38% YTD run.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • LVLT

    Level 3 Communications (LVLT +5.6%) says it expects to lay off hundreds of workers, mostly in...

    Level 3 Communications (LVLT +5.6%) says it expects to lay off hundreds of workers, mostly in the U.S., as it integrates its just-completed, $1.9B purchase of Global Crossing.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • MUR

    Murphy Oil (MUR +3.6%) gains after being upgraded on valuation to focus-stock status by a Howard...

    Murphy Oil (MUR +3.6%) gains after being upgraded on valuation to focus-stock status by a Howard Weil. The firm says the recent selloff in oil shares give investors the opportunity to pick up quality oil names like Murphy "on the cheap." Separately, SocGen also ups the shares to buy on valuation.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM
  • MRO

    Marathon Oil (MRO +5.5%) is higher today after SocGen ups the shares to buy on valuation, citing...

    Marathon Oil (MRO +5.5%) is higher today after SocGen ups the shares to buy on valuation, citing its attractive 2.7% dividend yield.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM | 1 Comment
  • NLSN

    Nielsen (NLSN +5.6%) to pops after Goldman ups it to buy on valuation. The firm cites the...

    Nielsen (NLSN +5.6%) to pops after Goldman ups it to buy on valuation. The firm cites the company's progress in de-leveraging and the addition of a number of key, multi-year contracts including Wal-Mart (WMT -0.7%).

     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM
  • RECN

    Resources Connection (RECN -1.2%) is trading lower, despite beating on its FQ1 earnings...

    Resources Connection (RECN -1.2%) is trading lower, despite beating on its FQ1 earnings yesterday. Profit more than doubled as revenue continued to climb, particularly in the company's international markets, but Bank of America and JP Morgan both lower their price targets due to the uncertain economic environment.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • APKT

    Networking stocks are outperforming strongly today, as investors brush off Acme Packet's (APKT...

    Networking stocks are outperforming strongly today, as investors brush off Acme Packet's (APKT -11.9%) Q3 warning, and instead focus on beaten-down valuations. CSCO +4.2%. JNPR +8.5%. RVBD +5.1%. BCSI +6.2%. CIEN +3.3%. BRCD +3.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • TZOO

    It's a two-day rally for shares of Travelzoo (TZOO +4.9%) despite a steep cut in its price...

    It's a two-day rally for shares of Travelzoo (TZOO +4.9%) despite a steep cut in its price target yesterday from Wedbush to $72 from $52. Investors may be jumping on the fact that the firm's new PT still reps 100% upside for shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • BB

    RIMM shares keep surging on the latest takeover rumor, now +14%, even though one analyst is...

    RIMM shares keep surging on the latest takeover rumor, now +14%, even though one analyst is already calling any such a deal a pipe dream. Bernstein's Pierre Ferragu says any takeover is “unlikely,” given the lack of potential buyers with enough cash. With handset gross margin “collapsing” and sales unit growth coming at the expense of average selling price, the go-it-alone outlook also isn't bright.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • AAN

    Aaron's (AAN +2.7%) posts a gain after announcing it agreed to acquire a 11.5% stake in...

    Aaron's (AAN +2.7%) posts a gain after announcing it agreed to acquire a 11.5% stake in U.K-based Perfect Home for 10M ($15.3M).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • GMRRQ

    General Maritime (GMR -8.3%) continues trading into the abyss after failing to make a scheduled...

    General Maritime (GMR -8.3%) continues trading into the abyss after failing to make a scheduled principal payment to its creditors yesterday. This morning S&P cut its rating again to selective default. The oil shipper has declined steadily from $5 a year ago to just pennies on the dollar today.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • FOE

    More on specialty chemical stocks (previous): KeyBanc's Michael Sison takes a stinging swipe at...

    More on specialty chemical stocks (previous): KeyBanc's Michael Sison takes a stinging swipe at the sector with a wave of downgrades, saying growth could be limited for the next 6 to 12 months. He doesn't buy into the valuation argument calling it a "pointless task...as 'cheapness' has been redefined on a weekly basis." Downgraded to Hold from Buy: FOE +1.2%, KRA +3.3%, OMN -6%, KWR -2.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • APOL

    Apollo Group (APOL +9.1%) tops the S&P leader board after Credit Suisse upgrades shares and...

    Apollo Group (APOL +9.1%) tops the S&P leader board after Credit Suisse upgrades shares and raises the price target to $47 from $35, citing changes to Apollo's business model that should lead to enrollment growth in FY2012; previous estimates had modeled enrollment declines. For-profit education peers also gain: CECO +7.7%, DV +5.4%, WPO +2.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • ARCH

    It's a bit of a strong bounce for coal stocks after an extended meltdown in shares (I, II, III)...

    It's a bit of a strong bounce for coal stocks after an extended meltdown in shares (I, II, III) now looks overdone to investors - for today at least. While spot coal prices have remained stable, it's ongoing concern over the global economy and demand that has hit coal companies in the gut over the last month. Gainers: ACI +8.4%, PCX +9.9%, ANR +9.8%, JRCC +14%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • FRX

    Shares of Forest Laboratories (FRX +2.9%) trade higher after it says preliminary results from a...

    Shares of Forest Laboratories (FRX +2.9%) trade higher after it says preliminary results from a clinical trial of its experimental antipsychotic drug cariprazine showed improvement of bipolar mania symptoms versus a placebo.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • RYAAY

    Euro airline Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) drops 3.4% after announcing it carried 7.25M passengers in...

    Euro airline Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) drops 3.4% after announcing it carried 7.25M passengers in September, a 6% Y/Y increase. Ryanair's load factor, which represents its ratio of passengers to available seats, fell 1% Y/Y to 85%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • SATCQ

    Satcon Technology (SATC) posts a 10.8% gain after the firm gets selected by Q-Cells to supply an...

    Satcon Technology (SATC) posts a 10.8% gain after the firm gets selected by Q-Cells to supply an additional 40MW of its solar power conversion systems for an Ontario project.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM
  • POL

    Shares of specialty chemical companies are getting hit hard this morning after PolyOne (POL...

    Shares of specialty chemical companies are getting hit hard this morning after PolyOne (POL -3.8%) takes on a downgrade from Keybank. An analyst with the firm says the sector "tends to be more cyclical" and will underperform as volumes slow. Decliners: OMN -9.5%, FOE -6.8%, KWR -5.3%, FTL -3.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM
  • GOOG

    Google's (GOOG -3.3%) pending Motorola Mobility (NYSE:MMI) acquisition could distract senior...

    Google's (GOOG -3.3%) pending Motorola Mobility (NYSE:MMI) acquisition could distract senior management while failing to protect Android and keeping it from returning capital to shareholders, Stifel Nicolaus writes in lowering shares to Hold from Buy. “The strategic position of Google is weakening... [and] the Internet’s center of gravity is shifting from Google to Facebook."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM | 1 Comment
  • ACOR

    Shares of Acorda Therapeutics (ACOR +2.4%) get a boost with an upgrade from Citi analyst Yaron...

    Shares of Acorda Therapeutics (ACOR +2.4%) get a boost with an upgrade from Citi analyst Yaron Weber to Buy from Hold who says the share price now reflects competitive market factors for the drugmaker. He forecasts sales of the firm's Ampyra to increase to $204M in 2011, just off the firm's target of $205M-$230M.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM
  • LUFK

    Shares of Lufkin Industries (NASDAQ:LUFK) fall off a cliff, down 15%, after the firm lowers its...

    Shares of Lufkin Industries (NASDAQ:LUFK) fall off a cliff, down 15%, after the firm lowers its forecast for Q3 profit to range of $0.55-$0.60 from $0.72-$0.82 on a potpourri of negative factors including materials shortages, labor unrest in Argentina, manufacturing inefficiencies, higher LIFO expenses, and shipment delays.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • KODK

    Premarket gainers: EK +10%. ALU +7%. AMR +5%. TPST +5%. DRYS +4%. NBG +3%.Losers: APKT -15%....

    Premarket gainers: EK +10%. ALU +7%. AMR +5%. TPST +5%. DRYS +4%. NBG +3%.
    Losers: APKT -15%. SPIL +5%. STD -4%. QGEN -3%. MS -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • AAL

    Shares of American Airlines (NASDAQ:AMR) gain 5.4% premarket, continuing to recover from...

    Shares of American Airlines (NASDAQ:AMR) gain 5.4% premarket, continuing to recover from Monday's steep selloff as negotiations with its pilots union progresses. As for AMR restructuring, insiders agree it looks to be off the table: "They don’t even speak the B-word."

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM
  • WBA

    Shares of Walgreen (WAG) lose 1.4% premarket after the firm reports September sales rose a brisk...

    Shares of Walgreen (WAG) lose 1.4% premarket after the firm reports September sales rose a brisk 5.4% Y/Y to $5.95B. A mild flu season (so far) negatively impacted prescription sales and flu shots for the month. Rivals: RAD +1%, CVS unchanged.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM
  • AAPL

    A different take on yesterday's jaw-dropping turnaround: Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) "textbook bounce"...

    A different take on yesterday's jaw-dropping turnaround: Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) "textbook bounce" off of its 200-day moving average lit the rally, not a rumor about EU bank recapitalizations. "The key metrics on the downside are now S&P500 1,075 and Apple's 200-day MA. All else is noise in our book."

     
     
     
     
    | 8:32 AM | 4 Comments
  • APKT

    Acme Packet (NASDAQ:APKT) has rebounded a little, but is still down 16.2% premarket thanks to...

    Acme Packet (NASDAQ:APKT) has rebounded a little, but is still down 16.2% premarket thanks to its Q3 warning, blamed by management on the push-out of a deal with AT&T (NYSE:T). Wedbush is upgrading Acme to Outperform following its drop, while Deutsche is reiterating a Buy, arguing the voice-over-IP market still represents a major growth opportunity for the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:30 AM
  • MON

    More on Monsanto's (NYSE:MON) FQ4 report: Sees FY12 mid-teens earnings growth to a range of...

    More on Monsanto's (NYSE:MON) FQ4 report: Sees FY12 mid-teens earnings growth to a range of $3.34-$3.44 EPS, boosted by above normal business in Latin America for Q1. The Seeds and Genomics segment is expected to kick in single-digit unit growth to derive gross profit in a range of $5.7B-$5.85B for the year. Shares +2.2% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 AM
  • DIS

    Citi upgrades Disney (NYSE:DIS) to a Buy rating from Hold with a $36 price target on shares....

    Citi upgrades Disney (NYSE:DIS) to a Buy rating from Hold with a $36 price target on shares. Analysts with the firm cite valuation, assigning a multiple of 13X forward earnings to derive their PT. Shares +1.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:10 AM
  • BCRX

    Shares of BioCryst Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:BCRX) shoot up 11% premarket after the firm announces...

    Shares of BioCryst Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:BCRX) shoot up 11% premarket after the firm announces positive top-line results for a Phase 2 study of its gout treatment that met its main goal.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:38 AM
